topic: Whether a word spoken in the Dens can be heard in the Capital
summary: Heated exchange between Grigsu and Yasho. Grigsu departed angrily shouting 'What do you know about anything?' Debate ruled incomplete.

topic: The permanence of the uttered word
summary: Yasho argued words dissolve upon speaking. Grigsu insisted they persist. Bagbu abstained. Yasho declared winner by the cardhouse master.

topic: Whether creature names precede creature discovery
summary: Philosophical discussion. Boffa argued names are assigned; Grigsu argued names are discovered. Mink mediated. No clear winner.

topic: The relationship between taxonomy and dissolution
summary: Yasho extended water-school principles to creature classification. Boffa conceded several points.

topic: Legal standing of verbal contracts in the Quarry
summary: Formal legal debate. Father and daughter Valdun argued opposing sides. Oric's interpretation upheld by Senate committee.

topic: The meaning of Yeller
summary: All five scholars present. Grigsu claimed Yeller proved stone-school principles. Yasho disagreed violently. Unusual number of stones cast.

topic: Pebbles versus water drops as model for words
summary: Final debate between Fibon and Eulr before Eulr's death. Mirado tradition does not cast stones. Eulr's position upheld by audience acclaim.

topic: Northern versus Capital stone-school traditions
summary: Grigsu and Hamund compared regional variations. Amicable discussion. Both agreed core principles were sound.

topic: The ethics of expedition documentation
summary: Yasho accused Mink of selective historical reporting. Mink denied. Yasho produced evidence. Mink's reputation damaged.

topic: Stone-school versus water-school poetics
summary: Tam Whistle and Lira Canto debated whether poems are assemblages or dissolutions. Ended in a poetry reading instead of resolution.

topic: The authenticity of northern maps
summary: Bagbu presented maps. Mink questioned their provenance. Bagbu stormed out. Later reconciled over kachot.

topic: Kachot scoring rules and word theory
summary: The infamous kachot dispute. Grigsu accused Mink of cheating with 'new rules.' Mink nursed resentment for years afterward.

topic: Classification of the stakdur
summary: Hesta Vorn and Jara Torval debated whether stakdur is one species or several. No resolution. Classification remains disputed.

topic: Whether stone-school can be reconciled with observation
summary: Oben Marsh attempted synthesis. Yasho demolished his arguments. Stone-school credibility further damaged in Capital circles.

topic: Family tree authentication methods
summary: Formal legal debate. Hork Staven's newer methods upheld over Oric Valdun's traditional approach.

topic: Accuracy standards for Quarry route maps
summary: Bagbu and Senna Grell compared methodologies. Agreed on new standards adopted by Cartographic Society.

topic: Extension of water-school principles to the seventy pools
summary: Vera Losh and Kell Sundar debated whether pools themselves follow dissolution principles. Unresolved. Both positions still held.

topic: Accuracy of Dens conquest historical accounts
summary: Mink defended his histories. Mara Yent raised questions. First hints of Mink's potential forgeries surfaced.

topic: The future of water-school philosophy
summary: Yasho passed the mantle to Nessa Bright. Ceremonial debate affirming continuity of the tradition.

topic: Literalism versus stone-school epistemology
summary: Oben Marsh and Roth Fenn debated distinctions between their schools. Found more agreement than expected.

topic: Legal standards for manuscript authentication
summary: Pella Valdun's stricter standards adopted. Implications for forgery detection.

topic: Reliability of expedition reports as historical sources
summary: Mara Yent and Donal Crest debated methodology. Agreed that cross-referencing was essential.

topic: Water-school versus stone-school taxonomy
summary: Renna Caw's dissolution-based taxonomy versus Jara Torval's naming-based approach. Renna's methods gained adherents.

topic: The role of repetition in verse
summary: Lira Canto and Tam Whistle revisited their old debate. More civil than the first. Still no resolution.

topic: Water-school versus pebble-school in modern context
summary: Nessa Bright demolished Denna Vox's attempt to revive pebble-school. Pebble-school effectively ended in the Capital.

topic: Evidence of forgery in stone-school manuscripts
summary: Mara Yent presented evidence against Mink. Mink denied. Debate inconclusive. Mara died before publishing findings.

topic: Proper methodology for synthesizing expedition data
summary: Donal Crest and Cort Madden established standards still used today.

topic: The relationship between Mirado and Capital water-schools
summary: Nessa Bright and Ulla Vant compared traditions. Found significant divergence over centuries.

topic: Dead River mapping controversies
summary: Gareth Poll and Vagabu compared their findings. Several discrepancies remain unexplained.

topic: Final ruling on Yeller Quarry family tree disputes
summary: Landmark legal debate. Pella Valdun's framework adopted as standard for all future authentication.
